meta.description: A database of doom predictions that failed to materialize. Add entries freely.

schema.prediction: the original scary claim, as it was framed at the time
schema.source: who made it — publication, institution, named expert
schema.category: one of the categories listed below
schema.tags: optional array of extra search tags

entries.prediction: The Y2K bug will crash global banking systems, power grids, and air traffic control at midnight on January 1st, 2000 — triggering a worldwide civilizational collapse.
entries.source: US Senate Special Committee on Y2K, major news networks
entries.reality: January 1st, 2000 arrived without incident. A handful of minor software glitches occurred in obscure systems. Planes did not fall from the sky. Banks did not lose records. Life continued normally.

entries.prediction: The battle to feed all of humanity is over. In the 1970s hundreds of millions of people will starve to death in spite of any crash programs embarked upon now.
entries.reality: Global food production grew faster than population. Famines that did occur were mostly caused by war and politics, not scarcity. Global caloric intake per person has risen significantly since 1968.

entries.prediction: Peak oil is imminent — global oil production will begin an irreversible decline by 2010, triggering economic collapse, resource wars, and the end of modern civilization.
entries.source: ASPO (Association for the Study of Peak Oil), multiple economists
entries.reality: U.S. oil production hit record highs by the 2010s due to fracking. Global oil supply remained robust. The feared resource wars did not materialize on the predicted scale.

entries.prediction: The world is entering a new ice age. Global cooling caused by industrial pollution will bring crop failures, mass starvation, and a dramatic drop in global temperatures within decades.
entries.reality: The planet warmed, not cooled. This prediction was based on a partial reading of the science at the time and was not the scientific consensus, though it was widely reported as such.

entries.prediction: The H1N1 swine flu pandemic will be as devastating as the 1918 Spanish flu — potentially killing tens of millions and overwhelming healthcare systems worldwide.
entries.source: WHO, CDC, and widespread international media coverage
entries.reality: H1N1 killed an estimated 151,000–575,000 people globally in its first year — serious, but far below the predicted catastrophic scale. It was later reclassified as a moderately severe flu.

entries.prediction: H5N1 bird flu is on the verge of mutating into a human-transmissible pandemic that could kill between 5 million and 150 million people worldwide.
entries.source: WHO, Dr. David Nabarro (UN), multiple health agencies
entries.reality: H5N1 never acquired efficient human-to-human transmission. As of the late 2010s, it had infected fewer than 1,000 people globally over a decade.

entries.prediction: The Eurozone is on the brink of collapse. Greece's debt crisis will trigger a chain reaction that destroys the single currency and possibly the European Union itself.
entries.source: Nouriel Roubini, numerous financial analysts, The Economist
entries.reality: The Euro survived. Greece received bailouts and remained in the Eurozone. The EU continued to function. While painful austerity followed, the predicted catastrophic breakup did not occur.

entries.prediction: The financial crisis of 2008 will trigger a second Great Depression — unemployment exceeding 25%, a decade of deflation, and a permanent collapse in living standards.
entries.reality: The recession was severe, but stimulus measures and bank bailouts prevented a depression. U.S. unemployment peaked at 10% and fell steadily. The economy recovered within a few years.

entries.prediction: The Federal Reserve's quantitative easing program will inevitably trigger hyperinflation, destroying the value of the US dollar and collapsing the American economy.
entries.source: Numerous economists, Ron Paul, Peter Schiff, Wall Street Journal op-eds
entries.reality: Inflation remained historically low through the 2010s, often falling below the Fed's 2% target. The predicted hyperinflation did not materialize despite years of QE.

entries.prediction: Japan will overtake the United States as the world's dominant economic power within a decade. Japanese companies will own America.
entries.source: Widespread US media consensus; multiple best-selling books
entries.reality: Japan's asset bubble burst in 1991, beginning the 'Lost Decade.' Japan's economy stagnated while the U.S. boomed through the 1990s. Japan never overtook the U.S. economy.

entries.prediction: The internet will catastrophically collapse under its own weight within two years. It cannot possibly scale to handle millions of users and will destroy itself.
entries.source: Robert Metcalfe, Ethernet inventor, InfoWorld (he ate his column when wrong)
entries.reality: The internet scaled remarkably well and grew to connect billions of people. Metcalfe publicly ate his words — literally blending a printed copy of his article and drinking it at a conference.

entries.prediction: The ancient Mayan calendar predicts the end of the world on December 21, 2012. A cosmic event — planetary alignment, solar flare, or rogue planet Nibiru — will end civilization.
entries.source: Widespread internet culture, multiple books, a Roland Emmerich film
entries.reality: December 22, 2012 arrived normally. Archaeologists noted that the Mayan calendar simply rolled over to a new cycle, as our own calendar does on January 1st.

entries.prediction: Acid rain from industrial pollution is destroying forests across Europe and North America so rapidly that they will be largely dead by the end of the century.
entries.source: West German government reports, widespread European media
entries.reality: Acid rain was a real problem, but clean air legislation dramatically reduced sulfur emissions. European and North American forests largely recovered. Forest cover has actually increased in many regions.

entries.prediction: The expanding ozone hole will increase UV radiation to catastrophic levels, devastating global agriculture and causing a mass extinction event within 50 years.
entries.source: Various scientific reports following the Montreal Protocol negotiations
entries.reality: The Montreal Protocol worked. The ozone hole has been measurably recovering since the 2000s. Agricultural catastrophe did not occur. The ozone layer is expected to fully recover by mid-century.

entries.prediction: Nuclear war between the US and USSR is nearly inevitable within the next few years. Able Archer 83 military exercises will trigger a Soviet first strike.
entries.source: KGB intelligence reports; Stanislav Petrov situation; multiple think tanks
entries.reality: Nuclear war did not occur. The Cold War ended peacefully in 1991 with the dissolution of the Soviet Union. No nuclear weapons have been used in conflict since 1945.

entries.prediction: The Kuwaiti oil fires set by Saddam Hussein will trigger a 'nuclear winter'-style cooling event, killing crops across Asia and causing mass starvation.
entries.source: Carl Sagan and colleagues; multiple atmospheric scientists
entries.reality: The fires were extinguished within months. The smoke rose higher than expected but dispersed without the catastrophic atmospheric effects predicted. Global crops were unaffected.

entries.prediction: SARS will spread globally and unstoppably, potentially infecting hundreds of millions and causing a pandemic worse than the 1918 flu.
entries.source: WHO emergency declarations; widespread media reporting
entries.reality: SARS infected about 8,000 people globally and killed 774. Aggressive containment — isolation, contact tracing, travel advisories — stopped it cold. It remains one of public health's great success stories.

entries.prediction: The dot-com crash marks the end of the internet economy. E-commerce has been proven a fantasy. The internet will never be central to commerce or daily life.
entries.reality: Amazon, Google, and Apple went on to become the most valuable companies in history. E-commerce now accounts for trillions of dollars annually. The internet became the central nervous system of global economy.

entries.prediction: Aircraft will fall from the sky on January 1, 2000, as Y2K bugs corrupt flight control computers mid-flight, causing mass aviation disasters worldwide.
entries.source: Various Y2K preparedness consultants; media reporting
entries.reality: Not a single plane fell from the sky. Aviation authorities had prepared extensively, and no significant Y2K-related aviation incidents occurred.

entries.prediction: The 2014 West African Ebola outbreak will inevitably spread beyond Africa and become a global pandemic, potentially killing millions in the developed world.
entries.source: Multiple US media outlets; some public health analysts
entries.reality: Ebola was devastating in West Africa but was contained. Outside Africa, only a handful of cases occurred — mostly healthcare workers who had treated patients. No global spread materialized.

entries.prediction: America is running out of landfill space. By the mid-1990s, the US will face a garbage crisis so severe that cities will not be able to dispose of trash.
entries.source: EPA reports; 'Garbage Crisis' media panic following the Mobro garbage barge
entries.reality: Recycling expanded, waste management improved, and the garbage crisis never materialized. Landfills became more efficient. Many regions reported surplus capacity.

entries.prediction: The Sino-Soviet border conflict will escalate into full-scale nuclear war between China and the Soviet Union, potentially drawing in the United States.
entries.source: Western intelligence assessments; mainstream media during Ussuri River skirmishes
entries.reality: The conflict remained a limited border skirmish. China and the Soviet Union stepped back from the brink. Nixon's subsequent opening to China fundamentally changed the geopolitical dynamic.

entries.prediction: Within 10–20 years, nearly half of all US jobs will be automated out of existence by AI and robotics, triggering mass unemployment and societal collapse.
entries.source: Oxford study by Frey & Osborne (47% of jobs at risk); widely cited in media
entries.reality: Automation has transformed many jobs without eliminating them at scale. US unemployment hit record lows in the late 2010s. New job categories emerged. The predicted mass unemployment did not materialize.

entries.prediction: Drug-resistant 'super gonorrhea' will spread globally within years and become entirely untreatable, triggering a sexual health catastrophe worse than the AIDS crisis.
entries.reality: Drug-resistant gonorrhea remains a serious public health concern, but new treatments continue to be developed. The predicted untreatable global outbreak did not materialize by the predicted timeline.

entries.prediction: By 2025, wars fought over fresh water will be more common than oil wars. Nations will collapse as rivers run dry and aquifers are depleted globally.
entries.source: World Bank VP Ismail Serageldin; numerous geopolitical analysts
entries.reality: Water scarcity is a genuine ongoing challenge, but widespread 'water wars' have not materialized. International water-sharing agreements have largely held.

entries.prediction: Social media will fragment society so completely by 2020 that democratic elections will become impossible, replaced by chaos and mob rule.
entries.source: Multiple political scientists; Eli Pariser 'The Filter Bubble'
entries.reality: Democratic elections continued to take place in nearly all established democracies. Social media has created real challenges for political discourse, but democracy has proven more resilient than predicted.

entries.prediction: 5G wireless networks will cause mass cancer outbreaks, immune system damage, and neurological disorders, creating a public health catastrophe within years of deployment.
entries.source: Viral social media; fringe scientists; widely shared petitions
entries.reality: 5G has been deployed in hundreds of cities globally. No evidence of the predicted health effects has emerged. Major health agencies worldwide found no evidence of harm.

entries.prediction: Following Three Mile Island, experts warned that the US nuclear power industry would experience multiple catastrophic meltdowns per decade, making large areas of the country uninhabitable.
entries.source: Anti-nuclear movement; various safety engineers; media consensus
entries.reality: Three Mile Island was the only significant US nuclear accident. No additional major meltdowns occurred in America. The industry continued operating with an improved safety record.

entries.prediction: Colony collapse disorder will cause total global bee population collapse within 5 years, triggering agricultural failure and the end of most flowering plant species.
entries.source: Multiple environmental scientists; UNEP reports; mainstream media
entries.reality: Colony collapse disorder remains a concern, but bee populations have shown resilience. US honeybee colony numbers stabilized. Global food production continued to grow.

entries.prediction: A generation of 'crack babies' will be permanently neurologically damaged, creating an untenable burden on social services and producing a cohort of children unable to function in society.
entries.source: CBS News, multiple pediatric researchers, Congressional testimony
entries.reality: Follow-up studies showed crack-exposed children fared no worse — and sometimes better — than children exposed to tobacco or alcohol. Poverty was the far greater developmental factor.

entries.prediction: Heroin addiction will permanently cripple an entire generation of returning Vietnam veterans, creating millions of untreatable addicts who will overwhelm American society.
entries.source: US government addiction researchers; Congressional reports
entries.reality: A landmark Lee Robins study found 95% of addicted veterans simply stopped using heroin after returning home. The vast majority of returning soldiers did not become lifetime addicts.

entries.prediction: Google Glass will be ubiquitous within 5 years, fundamentally destroying privacy and social interaction, with millions of people being secretly recorded at all times.
entries.source: Widespread tech media and privacy advocates
entries.reality: Google Glass was a commercial failure, discontinued for consumers in 2015. The feared 'glasshole' surveillance dystopia never arrived.

entries.prediction: Japan's economic model will be copied by all of Asia, making Western-style capitalism obsolete and condemning Europe and America to permanent economic decline.
entries.source: Multiple economic commentators post-Japanese bubble peak
entries.reality: Japan's bubble burst spectacularly. The 'Asian model' fell from favor after the 1997 Asian financial crisis. Western capitalism, while flawed, did not face the predicted obsolescence.

entries.prediction: Violent video games will create a generation of desensitized killers — violent crime, particularly among youth, will skyrocket to unprecedented levels by the 2000s.
entries.source: US Senate hearings; Joseph Lieberman; American Psychological Association
entries.reality: Youth violent crime in the US fell dramatically through the 1990s and 2000s — the very period when violent video games became mainstream. Research consistently failed to find a causal link.

entries.prediction: The economic devastation from COVID-19 lockdowns will cause a depression lasting 10+ years, permanently destroying the service sector and causing unemployment above 20% through the mid-2020s.
entries.source: Multiple financial analysts; IMF worst-case scenarios
entries.reality: The recovery was remarkably fast. US unemployment dropped from 14.7% in April 2020 to below 4% by 2022. Stock markets recovered within months. The feared decade-long depression did not materialize.

entries.prediction: Bitcoin will go to zero. The cryptocurrency bubble has burst permanently, and all crypto assets will be worthless within 12 months.
entries.source: Nouriel Roubini, multiple economists and financial commentators post-2017 crash
entries.reality: Bitcoin recovered and hit new all-time highs in 2020 and 2021. The entire crypto asset class continued to exist and grow, though with significant volatility.

entries.prediction: The newspaper industry will be completely dead within 5 years. The internet has made print journalism economically nonviable, and journalism itself will cease to exist as a profession.
entries.source: Multiple media analysts; Clay Shirky; widespread tech commentators
entries.reality: Print circulation fell sharply, but journalism survived and adapted. Digital news outlets flourished. Investigative journalism continued producing major exposes. The profession, though transformed, did not disappear.

entries.prediction: US military strikes on Iran are imminent and inevitable — war with Iran will begin within months, drawing in the entire Middle East and potentially triggering World War III.
entries.source: Seymour Hersh reporting; multiple intelligence analysts; widespread media
entries.reality: The US did not strike Iran. Diplomatic channels, including the 2015 nuclear deal, became the primary approach. As of the mid-2020s, direct US-Iran military conflict has not occurred.

entries.prediction: North Korea's rapid nuclear weapons development will inevitably trigger a US preemptive strike or North Korean first use within 12–18 months, leading to a war killing millions.
entries.source: Multiple US defense analysts; H.R. McMaster statements; media consensus
entries.reality: After a period of extreme tension, Trump and Kim Jong-un held summits in 2018-2019. No war occurred. North Korea continues to develop weapons, but large-scale conflict has been avoided.

entries.prediction: Alar pesticide residue on apples poses a massive cancer risk to American children — the apple industry must be shut down immediately or a pediatric cancer epidemic will follow.
entries.source: 60 Minutes; Natural Resources Defense Council; widespread media
entries.reality: The EPA later concluded that Alar posed no significant health risk at consumption levels. The scare caused enormous economic damage to apple farmers. No pediatric cancer epidemic emerged.

entries.prediction: Facebook's algorithm has so completely broken democracy that free, fair elections are now permanently impossible in any country where Facebook operates at scale.
entries.source: Multiple political scientists; tech journalists; post-2016 analysis
entries.reality: Elections have continued in over 100 countries. While social media has real effects on political discourse, elections have not ceased. Several incumbents backed by sophisticated social media operations have lost.

entries.prediction: AI will replace most surgeons, lawyers, and accountants within a decade — entire skilled professions will vanish, and the middle-class professional will go extinct.
entries.source: McKinsey Global Institute; multiple technology forecasters
entries.reality: AI has become a powerful tool for these professions, but has not replaced them. The number of licensed surgeons, lawyers, and accountants has grown. New AI-adjacent roles emerged alongside old ones.

entries.prediction: China's economy is riddled with bad debt, corruption, and unsustainable growth — it will suffer a catastrophic economic collapse within 5–10 years.
entries.source: Gordon Chang, 'The Coming Collapse of China'
entries.reality: China did not collapse. It became the world's second-largest economy, lifted hundreds of millions out of poverty, and joined the WTO. The book's prediction remains spectacularly unfulfilled.

entries.prediction: Telephone wires crisscrossing cities will interfere with the natural electrical fields of the human body, causing epidemic rates of neurological disease and mental illness.
entries.source: American medical journals; physician letters to newspapers
entries.reality: Telephones became ubiquitous without any such health effects. The predicted epidemic of telephone-induced neurological disease never occurred.

entries.prediction: Home video recorders will destroy the film industry through piracy. The VCR is to the American film producer what the Boston Strangler is to a woman home alone.
entries.source: Jack Valenti, MPAA President, Congressional testimony
entries.reality: The VCR created the home video market, which became a massive revenue stream for studios. Home video sales and rentals generated more revenue than theatrical releases for decades.

entries.prediction: Variant CJD (human mad cow disease) will infect hundreds of thousands to millions of Britons who ate contaminated beef, causing an epidemic of fatal brain disease.
entries.source: UK government scientists; Nature journal estimates; widespread media
entries.reality: vCJD caused approximately 180 deaths in the UK through 2020. Devastating for those affected, but the predicted mass epidemic did not materialize.

entries.prediction: Power lines emit electromagnetic fields that will cause a childhood leukemia epidemic — millions of homes near power lines must be vacated immediately.
entries.source: New Yorker (Paul Brodeur); widespread media; some scientists
entries.reality: Decades of follow-up studies found no consistent evidence linking power line EMF to childhood leukemia. The proposed epidemic never materialized. EMF guidelines were set conservatively as a precaution.

entries.prediction: Africanized 'killer bees' spreading north from South America will reach the US by 1990 and kill thousands of Americans annually, creating a public health emergency.
entries.source: USDA entomologists; widespread media; multiple government reports
entries.reality: Africanized bees did reach the US (Texas, 1990) but their impact was far more limited than predicted. Annual deaths from all bee stings in the US typically range from 40–100.

entries.prediction: Asteroid Apophis has a 2.7% chance — the highest ever calculated — of directly striking Earth in 2029, potentially causing regional devastation equal to thousands of nuclear bombs.
entries.reality: Further orbital calculations eliminated any 2029 impact risk. Apophis will pass within 20,000 miles of Earth in 2029 — close but safe. NASA confirmed zero impact risk through at least 2116.

entries.prediction: MRSA (drug-resistant staph) is spreading through communities uncontrollably and will become an untreatable pandemic killing more people than AIDS within a decade.
entries.reality: MRSA rates declined significantly after peak years in 2007. Infection control practices improved. While antibiotic resistance remains a serious public health concern, the predicted AIDS-scale pandemic did not materialize.

entries.prediction: Internet addiction will destroy an entire generation — by 2010, a majority of teenagers will be clinically addicted, unable to form relationships or hold employment.
entries.source: Multiple psychologists; media panics; congressional hearings
entries.reality: While excessive screen time has real effects, the predicted generation of clinically addicted, unemployable young people did not emerge. Millennials — the first internet generation — show high rates of education and workforce participation.

entries.prediction: Iran will have a nuclear weapon within 12–18 months. Nothing can stop this, and a nuclear-armed Iran will trigger an immediate nuclear exchange with Israel.
entries.source: Multiple US intelligence assessments (later revised); numerous think tanks
entries.reality: Iran did not produce a nuclear weapon. The 2015 nuclear deal significantly constrained its program. No nuclear exchange with Israel occurred.

entries.prediction: Television will destroy children's capacity for literacy, imagination, and social bonding. Within a generation, TV will produce a population incapable of reading or critical thought.
entries.source: Marie Winn 'The Plug-In Drug'; FCC Chairman Newton Minow; prominent educators
entries.reality: Literacy rates continued to improve globally through the television age. Critical thinking skills, while always in debate, did not collapse. The feared generation of illiterates never arrived.

entries.prediction: Consumers will never trust giving credit card numbers to a website. E-commerce is a fantasy — people will never buy things they can't physically examine from faceless online stores.
entries.source: Clifford Stoll, Newsweek; multiple retail analysts
entries.reality: Global e-commerce surpassed $5 trillion annually by the early 2020s. Billions of people routinely make online purchases. Amazon became one of the most valuable companies in history.

entries.prediction: Various Christian clerics predicted this date as the Millennium , including Pope Sylvester II . As a result, riots are said to have occurred in Europe and pilgrims headed east to Jerusalem. Many historians, however, dispute that any of these events ever took place.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1005.

entries.prediction: Following the failure of the 1 January 1000 prediction, some theorists proposed that the end would occur 1,000 years after Jesus' death, instead of his birth.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1038.

entries.prediction: This Italian mystic determined that the Millennium would begin between 1200 and 1260.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1205.

entries.prediction: Pope Innocent III (died 1216) predicted that the world would end 666 years after the rise of Islam.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1289.

entries.prediction: After his 1260 prediction failed, the followers of Joachim of Fiore rescheduled the end of the world to 1290 and then again to 1335.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1295.

entries.prediction: The black plague spreading across Europe was interpreted by many as the sign of the end of times.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1351.

entries.prediction: This French alchemist predicted the Antichrist was to come in 1366 and the Millennium would begin either in 1368 or 1370.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1373.

entries.prediction: This Joachite wrote that the Antichrist was to come during this year.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1383.

entries.prediction: Many Russian Orthodox Christians beginning from the 1400s believed this year would see Christ's return, since it would be the end of the seventh millennium and the start of the eighth millennium (the year 8000) according to the Byzantine calendar . In 1408, this belief led to the Russian Orthodox Church making the decision not to compute the date of Easter beyond 1491.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1497.

entries.prediction: This painter believed he was living during the Tribulation, and that the Millennium would begin in three and a half years from 1500. He wrote into his painting The Mystical Nativity that the Devil was loose and would soon be chained.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1509.

entries.prediction: A group of astrologers in London predicted the world would end by a flood starting in London, based on calculations made the previous June. Twenty thousand Londoners left their homes and headed for higher ground in anticipation.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1529.

entries.prediction: A planetary alignment in Pisces was seen by this astrologer as a sign of the Millennium.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1529.

entries.prediction: 1525 would mark the beginning of the Millennium, according to this Anabaptist . His followers were killed by cannon fire in an uneven battle with government troops. He died under torture and was beheaded.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1529.

entries.prediction: This German Anabaptist predicted the end would occur on this date.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1533.

entries.prediction: A revised date from Stöffler after his 1524 prediction failed to come true.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1533.

entries.prediction: This mathematician calculated that Judgement Day would begin at 8:00 am on this day.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1538.

entries.prediction: This Anabaptist prophet predicted Christ's Second Coming to take place this year in Strasbourg . He claimed that 144,000 people would be saved, while the rest of the world would be consumed by fire.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1538.

entries.prediction: During the Münster rebellion , this Anabaptist leader declared that the apocalypse would take place on this day. When the day came he led a failed attack against Franz von Waldeck and was decapitated.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1539.

entries.prediction: Around 1400, this French theologian wrote that 6845 years of human history had already passed, and the end of the world would be in the 7000th year.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1560.

entries.prediction: In his book The Restoration of Christianity , the Spanish born reformer claimed that the Devil's reign in this world had started in 325 AD, at the Council of Nicea , and would last for 1260 years, thus ending in 1585.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1590.

entries.prediction: This mathematician and astronomer predicted the end of the world during this year.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1593.

entries.prediction: Luther, a German priest and professor of theology, predicted the end of the world would occur no later than 1600.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1605.

entries.prediction: The same astrologers who had predicted the deluge of 1 February 1524 recalculated the date to 100 years later after their first prophecy failed.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1629.

entries.prediction: Using the kabbalah , this rabbi from Turkey proclaimed that the Messiah would come during that year.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1653.

entries.prediction: The apocalypse maps tell of an Antichrist, the rise of Islam and other events following Judgement Day that was predicted to occur in 1651.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1656.

entries.prediction: This physician made a prediction that the world would end this year based on a nova that occurred in 1572.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1659.

entries.prediction: In his Book of Prophecies (1501), Columbus predicted that the world would end during this year.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1661.

entries.prediction: This group of radical Christians predicted that the final apocalyptic battle and the destruction of the Antichrist were to take place between 1655 and 1657.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1660.

entries.prediction: Columbus claimed that the world was created in 5343 BCE and would last 7,000 years. Assuming no year zero, that means the end would come in 1658.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1663.

entries.prediction: Mede claimed that the Antichrist had appeared in 456, and the end would come in 1660.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1665.

entries.prediction: Following his failed prediction of 1648, Zevi recalculated the end of the Earth for this year.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1671.

entries.prediction: This Fifth Monarchist claimed the Millennium would begin by this year.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1678.

entries.prediction: This mathematician calculated the end of the world would be on this year based on calculations from the Book of Revelation .
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1693.

entries.prediction: This prophet predicted that Judgement Day would occur this year.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1694.

entries.prediction: This Anglican priest predicted the Millennium would begin by this year.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1699.

entries.prediction: This Puritan minister predicted the world would end this year. After the prediction failed, he revised the date of the end two more times.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1702.

entries.prediction: Following his 1688 prediction, Napier recalculated his end of the world prediction to 1700 in A Plaine Discovery , a book published in 1593.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1705.

entries.prediction: Camisard prophets predicted the end of the world would occur in either 1705, 1706 or 1708.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1710.

entries.prediction: Revised prediction from Mather after his 1697 prediction failed to come true.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1721.

entries.prediction: This mathematician predicted a comet would destroy the Earth on this day.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1724.

entries.prediction: This medieval cardinal predicted the end would occur between 1700 and 1734.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1705.

entries.prediction: This theologian predicted a comet colliding with the Earth this year.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1741.

entries.prediction: Mather's third and final prediction for the end of the world.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1741.

entries.prediction: Swedenborg, a Lutheran theologian, claimed that the Last Judgement occurred in the spiritual world this year.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1762.

entries.prediction: The sky turning dark during the day was interpreted as a sign of the end times . The primary cause of the event is believed to have been a combination of smoke from forest fires, a thick fog, and cloud cover.
entries.source: Connecticut General Assembly members, New Englanders
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1785.

entries.prediction: The year 1789 would bring the coming of the Antichrist, according to this 14th-century cardinal.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1794.

entries.prediction: The Shakers, a Christian sect founded in 18th-century England, predicted the world would end in 1792 and then in 1794.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1797.

entries.prediction: While campaigning for Richard Brothers ' release, Halhead proclaimed that the world would end on this day.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1800.

entries.prediction: This retired sailor stated the Millennium would begin between 1793 and 1795. He was eventually committed to an insane asylum.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1798.

entries.prediction: This Presbyterian minister predicted the destruction of the world by earthquake in 1805, followed by an age of everlasting peace when God would be known by all.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1810.

entries.prediction: In Leeds, England , in 1806 a hen began laying eggs on which the phrase "Christ is coming" was written. Eventually it was discovered to be a hoax. The owner, Mary Bateman , had written on the eggs in a corrosive ink so as to etch the eggs, and reinserted the eggs back into the hen's oviduct .
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1811.

entries.prediction: This 64-year-old self-described prophet claimed she was pregnant with the Christ child, and that he would be born on 19 October 1814. She died later that year having not delivered a child, and an autopsy proved she had not been pregnant.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1819.

entries.prediction: During a large Leonids meteor shower, several people including Joseph Smith believed that it was a sign of Jesus' second coming .
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1838.

entries.prediction: In the 1730s this Lutheran clergyman proclaimed that Judgment Day would come in 1836, with the pope as the anti-Christ and the Freemasons representing the "false prophet" of Revelations.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1841.

entries.prediction: Wesley, the founder of the Methodist Church, foresaw the Millennium beginning this year. He wrote that Revelation 12:14 referred to 1058 to 1836, "when Christ should come".
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1841.

entries.prediction: Although it was not officially endorsed by their leadership, many Millerites expected the Second Coming to occur on 28 April or at the end of 1843.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1848.

entries.prediction: The first of two years this preacher predicted the world would end.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1848.

entries.prediction: Miller, a Baptist preacher, predicted Christ would return on this day.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1849.

entries.prediction: After Christ did not return on 21 March 1844, the Millerites then revised William Miller's prediction to 22 October the same year, claiming to have miscalculated Scripture. The realization that the predictions were incorrect resulted in the Great Disappointment .
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1849.

entries.prediction: Rapp, the founder of the Harmony Society , preached that Jesus would return in his lifetime, even as he lay dying on 7 August 1847.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1852.

entries.prediction: The second prediction of the end of the world from this preacher.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1852.

entries.prediction: This Scottish clergyman stated it was 6,000 years since creation in 1862, and that the world would end.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1867.

entries.prediction: The founder of the Christian Israelite Church calculated that the Millennium would begin this year.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1868.

entries.prediction: In 1870, Wendell published his views in the booklet entitled The Present Truth, or Meat in Due Season concluding that the Second Advent was sure to occur in 1873.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1878.

entries.prediction: This Christian minister predicted the return of Jesus to occur in 1874, and after this date reinterpreted the prediction to say that Jesus had indeed returned in invisible form.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1879.

entries.prediction: This 15th-century prophet was quoted as saying "The world to an end shall come, In eighteen hundred and eighty one" in a book published in 1862. In 1873 it was revealed to be a forgery; however, this did not stop some people from expecting the end.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1886.

entries.prediction: The founder of the Ghost Dance movement predicted in 1889 that the Millennium would occur in 1890.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1895.

entries.prediction: Founded in 1831, this church claimed that Jesus would return by the time the last of its 12 founding members died. The last member died in 1901.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1906.

entries.prediction: Keeler, a prominent doctor in Connecticut, predicted that due to the alignment of the planets, the world would come to an end and "complete the planetary cycle as it was in the days of Noah".
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1906.

entries.prediction: Flammarion predicted that the 1910 appearance of Halley's Comet "would impregnate that atmosphere and possibly snuff out all life on the planet" but not the planet itself. "Comet pills" were sold to protect against toxic gases.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1915.

entries.prediction: This pyramidologist concluded from his research on the dimensions of the Great Pyramid of Giza that the Second Coming would occur somewhere between 1892 and 1911.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1897.

entries.prediction: Russell said "...the battle of the great day of God Almighty... The date of the close of that 'battle' is definitely marked in Scripture as October 1914. It is already in progress, its beginning dating from October, 1874."
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1919.

entries.prediction: This Baptist educator and leader of a rebellion in the British protectorate of Nyasaland predicted the Millennium would begin this year.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1920.

entries.prediction: "Christendom shall be cut off and glorification of the Little Flock (The Church) in the Spring of 1918 A. D."
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1923.

entries.prediction: In 1918, Christendom would go down as a system to oblivion and be succeeded by revolutionary governments. God would "destroy the churches wholesale and the church members by the millions." Church members would "perish by the sword of war, revolution and anarchy." The dead would lie unburied. In 1920 all earthly governments would disappear, with worldwide anarchy prevailing.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1925.

entries.prediction: According to this Seventh-Day Adventist , the angel Gabriel appeared before her in a vision and told her that the world would end at midnight on this date.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1930.

entries.prediction: This British MP, who was one of the 12 apostles of the Catholic Apostolic Church , believed that the world was growing nearer to the Apocalypse due to what he viewed as the rampant immorality of the times in Europe.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1931.

entries.prediction: This evangelist announced that "the world is going to go 'puff' and disappear" in September 1935.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1940.

entries.prediction: The founder of the Worldwide Church of God told members of his church that the Rapture was to take place in 1936, and that only they would be saved. After the prophecy failed, he changed the date three more times.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1941.

entries.prediction: A prediction of the end from the Jehovah's Witnesses, a group that branched from the Bible Student movement.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1946.

entries.prediction: The first of three revised dates from Armstrong after his 1936 prediction failed to come true.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1948.

entries.prediction: The author of Oahspe: A New Bible foresaw the destruction of all nations and the beginning of post-apocalyptic anarchy in this year.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1952.

entries.prediction: The world was to be destroyed by terrible flooding on this date, claimed this leader of a UFO cult called Brotherhood of the Seven Rays . The fallout of the group after the prediction failed was the basis for the 1956 book When Prophecy Fails .
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1959.

entries.prediction: The second prophet of the Branch Davidians predicted the apocalypse foretold in the Book of Revelation would proceed on this date. The failure of the prophecy led to the split of the sect into several subsects, the most prominent led by Benjamin and Lois Roden.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1964.

entries.prediction: Dixon predicted a planetary alignment on this day was to bring destruction to the world. Mass prayer meetings were held in India.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1967.

entries.prediction: This day would mark the beginning of the third woe of the Apocalypse, during which the southeastern US would be destroyed by a Soviet nuclear attack, according to this UFO prophet, who claimed to have channeled an alien named Ashtar .
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1972.

entries.prediction: The founder of the People's Temple stated he had visions that a nuclear holocaust was to take place in 1967.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1972.

entries.prediction: The founder of the Church of the Firstborn predicted the Second Coming of Christ would occur on this day.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1974.

entries.prediction: Manson predicted that Helter skelter , an apocalyptic race war, would occur in 1969.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1974.

entries.prediction: The second of three revised dates from Armstrong after his 1936 and 1943 predictions failed to come true.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1977.

entries.prediction: Berg, the leader of Children of God , predicted that there would be a colossal doomsday event heralded by Comet Kohoutek .
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1979.

entries.prediction: Armstrong's fourth and final prediction.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1980.

entries.prediction: The Brahma Kumaris founder, Lekhraj Kirpalani, has made a number of predictions of a global Armageddon which the religion believes it will inspire, internally calling it "Destruction". During Destruction, Brahma Kumari leaders teach the world will be purified, all of the rest of humanity killed by nuclear or civil wars and natural disasters which will include the sinking of all other continents except India.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1981.

entries.prediction: The founder of the Christian Israelite Church predicted this year for Armageddon to occur.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1982.

entries.prediction: Jensen predicted in 1978 that there would be a nuclear disaster in 1980, followed by two decades of conflict, culminating in God's Kingdom being established on Earth.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1985.

entries.prediction: The founder of Calvary Chapel predicted that the generation of 1948 would be the last generation and the world would end by 1981. Smith said that he "could be wrong" but added that his prediction was "a deep conviction in my heart, and all my plans are predicated upon that belief."
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1986.

entries.prediction: Gribbin, an astrophysicist, co-authored the 1974 book The Jupiter Effect which predicted that combined gravitational forces of aligned planets would create a number of catastrophes, including a great earthquake on the San Andreas Fault .
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1987.

entries.prediction: Creme took out an ad in the Los Angeles Times stating that the Second Coming would occur in June 1982, and the Maitreya announced it on worldwide television.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1987.

entries.prediction: In late 1976, Robertson predicted on his The 700 Club TV programme that the end of the world would come in this year.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1987.

entries.prediction: This Pentecostal minister predicted the end of the world in this year, even writing a book about it entitled I Predict 1985 .
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1990.

entries.prediction: Jensen predicted that Halley's Comet would be pulled into Earth's orbit on this day, causing widespread destruction.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1991.

entries.prediction: Argüelles claimed that Armageddon would happen unless 144,000 people gathered in certain places across the world in order to " resonate in harmony " on this day.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1992.

entries.prediction: Whisenant predicted in his book 88 Reasons Why the Rapture Could Be in 1988 that the Rapture of the Christian Church would occur between 11 and 13 September 1988. After this prediction failed to come true, Whisenant revised his prediction date to 3 October.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1993.

entries.prediction: After all his 1988 predictions failed to come true, Whisenant revised his prediction date to this day.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1994.

entries.prediction: Prophet predicted a nuclear war would start on this day, and the world would end 12 years later, leading her followers to stockpile a shelter with supplies and weapons. After Prophet's prediction did not come to pass, she was later diagnosed with epilepsy and Alzheimer's disease .
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1995.

entries.prediction: This Russian-born rabbi called for the Messiah to come by the start of the Jewish New Year .
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1996.

entries.prediction: The leader of the Nation of Islam declared that the Gulf War would be the "War of Armageddon which is the final war".
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1996.

entries.prediction: This born-again Christian predicted the Rapture would take place on this day.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1997.

entries.prediction: Lee, the leader of the Dami Mission church, predicted the rapture would occur on this day.
entries.source: Lee Jang Rim (이장림 or 李長林)
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1997.

entries.prediction: Berg predicted the tribulation would start in 1989 and that the Second Coming would take place in 1993.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1998.

entries.prediction: When his 1993 prediction failed to materialise, Whisenant updated it to 1994.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1999.

entries.prediction: This Bahá'í sect leader predicted that New York City would be destroyed by a nuclear bomb on 23 March 1994, and the Battle of Armageddon would take place 40 days later.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1999.

entries.prediction: Camping predicted the Rapture would occur on 6 September 1994. When it failed to occur he revised the date to 29 September and then 2 October.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1999.

entries.prediction: Camping's fourth predicted date for the end. This would be Camping's last prediction until 2011.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2000.

entries.prediction: Nidle, a Californian psychic, predicted that the world would end on this date, with the arrival of 16 million space ships and a host of angels.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2001.

entries.prediction: Applewhite, leader of the Heaven's Gate cult , claimed that a spacecraft was trailing the Comet Hale-Bopp and argued that suicide was "the only way to evacuate this Earth" so that the cult members' souls could board the supposed craft and be taken to another "level of existence above human". Applewhite and 38 of his followers committed mass suicide.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2002.

entries.prediction: This 17th-century Irish archbishop predicted this date to be 6,000 years since creation and therefore the end of the world.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2002.

entries.prediction: Chen, leader of the Taiwanese cult Chen Tao – "The True Way" – claimed that God would come to Earth in a flying saucer at 10:00 am on this date.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2003.

entries.prediction: A quatrain by Nostradamus that stated the "King of Terror" would come from the sky in "1999 and seven months" was frequently interpreted as a prediction of doomsday in July 1999.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2004.

entries.prediction: The predicted date of the end of the world, according to this psychic well known for predictions.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2004.

entries.prediction: Berg, dean of the worldwide Kabbalah Centre , stated that on this date "a ball of fire will descend, destroying almost all of mankind, all vegetation, all forms of life."
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2004.

entries.prediction: This linguist predicted the end would occur in this year. He did not predict how it would happen, stating that it might involve nuclear devastation, asteroid impact, pole shift or other Earth changes.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2004.

entries.prediction: This preacher predicted the great tribulation would begin before 2000.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2005.

entries.prediction: During and before 1999, there were widespread predictions of a computer bug that would crash many computers at midnight on 1 January 2000, causing malfunctions that would lead to major catastrophes worldwide, and that society would cease to function.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2005.

entries.prediction: The leader of the True and Living Church of Jesus Christ of Saints of the Last Days predicted the Second Coming of Christ would occur on this day.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2005.

entries.prediction: This movement claimed that the planetary lineup would cause a "star holocaust", pulling the planets toward the Sun on this day.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2005.

entries.prediction: This columnist for the Nation of Islam predicted the end would occur in this year.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2006.

entries.prediction: Lieder originally predicted the date for the Nibiru collision as May 2003. According to her website, aliens in the Zeta Reticuli star system told her through messages via a brain implant of a planet which would enter the Solar System and cause a pole shift on Earth that would destroy most of humanity.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2008.

entries.prediction: This Japanese cult, which carried out the Tokyo subway sarin attack in 1995, predicted the world would be destroyed by a nuclear war between 30 October and 29 November 2003.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2008.

entries.prediction: Yisrayl Hawkins, pastor and overseer of The House of Yahweh, predicted in his February 2006 newsletter that a nuclear war would begin on 12 September 2006.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2011.

entries.prediction: In his 1990 book The New Millennium , Robertson suggests this date as the day of Earth's destruction.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2012.

entries.prediction: The founder of the True Russian Orthodox Church predicted doomsday would occur this month. Kuznetsov and his followers hid in a cave in anticipation of the end, and Kuznetsov attempted suicide after his prediction failed to come true.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2012.

entries.prediction: This magical organization , which existed from 1887 to 1903, predicted the world would end during this year.
entries.source: Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2015.

entries.prediction: Camping predicted that the Rapture and devastating earthquakes would occur on this date , with God taking approximately 3% of the world's population into Heaven, and that the end of the world would occur five months later on 21 October.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2016.

entries.prediction: Weinland, the founder of the Church of God Preparing for the Kingdom of God , stated Jesus would return on this day. After his prophecy failed to come true he changed the date to 27 May 2012.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2016.

entries.prediction: When his original prediction failed to come true five months earlier, Camping revised his prediction by saying that on 21 May a "Spiritual Judgment" had taken place, and both the physical Rapture and the end of the world would occur on 21 October 2011.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2016.

entries.prediction: There were fears amongst the public that Comet Elenin travelling almost directly between Earth and the Sun would cause disturbances to the Earth's crust, causing massive earthquakes and tidal waves. Others predicted that Elenin would collide with Earth on 16 October. Scientists stated that none of these events were possible in an effort to calm the public.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2016.

entries.prediction: Weinland's revised date for the return of Jesus following the failure of his 2011 prediction.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2017.

entries.prediction: This cult leader predicted that the world's governments and economies would fail on this day, and that he and his followers would undergo a transformation that would allow them to fly and walk through walls.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2017.

entries.prediction: The 2012 phenomenon predicted the world would end at the end of the 13th b'ak'tun . The Earth would be destroyed by an asteroid, Nibiru, or some other interplanetary object; an alien invasion ; or a supernova . Mayanist scholars stated that no extant classic Maya accounts forecasted impending doom, and that the idea that the Long Count calendar ends in 2012 misrepresented Maya history and culture. Scientists from NASA , along with expert archeologists, stated that none of those events were possible.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2017.

entries.prediction: Rasputin, a Russian mystic who died in 1916, prophesied a storm would take place on this day where fire would destroy most life on land and Jesus would come back to Earth to comfort those in distress.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2018.

entries.prediction: The so-called blood moon prophecy , first predicted by Mark Blitz in 2008 and then by John Hagee in 2014. These Christian ministers claim that the tetrad in 2014 and 2015 may represent the beginning of the Messianic end times .
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2019.

entries.prediction: Conspiracy theorist David Meade predicted that Nibiru would become visible in the sky and would "soon" destroy the Earth.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2022.

entries.prediction: After his 2017 prediction failed, Meade predicted the rapture would take place and that the world would end on this date.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2023.

entries.prediction: Weinland had previously predicted the world would end in 2011, and then 2012.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2024.

entries.prediction: Dixon predicted that Armageddon would take place in 2020. She had previously predicted the world would end on 4 February 1962.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2025.

entries.prediction: This American pastor based his prediction on the prior suggestion that Jesus would return in 1988, i.e., within one biblical generation (40 years) of the founding of Israel in 1948. Beshore argued that the prediction was correct, but that the definition of a biblical generation was incorrect and was actually 70–80 years, placing the second coming of Jesus between 2018 and 2028 and the rapture by 2021 at the latest.
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 2025.

entries.prediction: South African pastor Joshua Mhlakela prophesied the Biblical Rapture where Jesus would ascend true believers to heaven before global tribulation, leading to the hashtag # RaptureTok on TikTok with videos amassing millions of views on tips like survival kits for those "left behind" and historical context of repeated failed predictions. Mhlakela later revised his prediction date based on the Julian calendar after its initial failure.
entries.source: Joshua Mhlakela and various TikTok users

entries.prediction: Plateau by 2004
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1984.

entries.prediction: Plateau around 2000
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1986.

entries.prediction: OPEC plateau 2000–2050
entries.reality: The predicted event did not occur as described by 1999.
